characters.Name: Narrator
characters.Description: Narrates the scene and other details not spoken by the actual characters in the story.

characters.Name: Ron
characters.Description: He is a news anchor at a news station. He is a middle-aged American male. His personality is a bit forward and inarticulate.

characters.Name: Veronica
characters.Description: She works as the staff at a news station, the same one as Ron. She is quiet, but has a mischievous streak.

dialogue.Speaker: Narrator
dialogue.Text: Ron walks into the newsroom. He stops dead in his tracks when he sees Veronica. He approaches.

dialogue.Speaker: Ron
dialogue.Text: Hope I'm not disturbing you, but, uh, I saw you from across the room and, uh, I don't usually do this, but I felt compelled to tell you something. You have an absolutely breathtaking heinie. I mean, that thing's good. I want to be friends with it.

dialogue.Speaker: Veronica
dialogue.Text: Well, you certainly know how to compliment a woman. Now if you'll excuse me.

dialogue.Speaker: Narrator
dialogue.Text: She walks off. Ron watches her go.

dialogue.Speaker: Ron
dialogue.Text: I'm going to be honest with you, that smells like pure gasoline.

dialogue.Speaker: Ron
dialogue.Text: They've done studies, you know. 60% of the time, it works every time.
